{"id":1088159002,"question_id":2311,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"7 months, 2 weeks","timestamp":1698735632,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"110 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1088159002/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Minimum White Tiles After Covering With Carpets","memory":"47.6 MB","code":"class Solution {\n    public int minimumWhiteTiles(String floor, int numCarpets, int carpetLen) {\n        int m = floor.length(); \n        int n = numCarpets;\n\n\n        char[] arr = floor.toCharArray();\n        int[][] dp = new int[m+1][n+1]; // dp [# of tiles][# of carpets]\n\n        for(int i=1; i<=m; i++){\n            for(int j=0; j<=n; j++){\n\n                dp[i][j]= Integer.MAX_VALUE/2;\n\n                if(j==0){ // when not using carpet\n                    dp[i][j] = dp[i-1][j] + (arr[i-1]=='1' ? 1 : 0);\n\n                }else if(i<= carpetLen){ // cover all floor\n                    dp[i][j] = 0;\n\n                }else{\n\n                    dp[i][j] = Math.min(dp[i][j], dp[i-1][j] + (arr[i-1]=='1' ? 1 : 0));\n                    dp[i][j] = Math.min(dp[i][j], dp[i-carpetLen][j-1]);\n\n                }\n\n            }\n        }\n        return dp[m][n];\n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"minimum-white-tiles-after-covering-with-carpets","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
